newsitem.title: USA: Florida Panthers to buy Naples, Fla. hotel.
newsitem.headline: Florida Panthers to buy Naples, Fla. hotel.

text.p: Wayne Huizenga's Florida Panthers Holdings Inc took another step towards its goal of becoming a "diversified leisure time sports and entertainment company" with the purchase of a luxury Florida hotel and said it was on the prowl for similar acquisitions.

The company said it would buy a controlling stake in the luxury Registry Hotel in Naples, Florida for $75 million cash. It will also issue 930,000 shares of Class A common stock, subject to some lock-up restrictions for up to two years.

The company said it bought the hotel from the Leehill Group, which is privately held. The Panthers own the Florida Panthers hockey team, interests in the team's arena, and has purchased three other Florida hotels since it went public in November at $10 a share.
The stock slipped 1/4 to 23 in early trading Wednesday. It currently trades on the Nasdaq but will begin trading on the NYSE under the symbol "PAW" on Friday, July 11.

"We are very pleased with this transaction which adds to the company a very profitable and prestigious asset ... We are continuing to explore other high quality opportunities in luxury resorts and club properties," said H. Wayne Huizenga, Chairman of Florida Panthers Holdings Inc.
The company also filed for a secondary offering of up to six million shares of Class A stock, it said.
